Author: zack#6467
Content:
Oracles CC it is not an oracle. You can't use it to bring data about reality onto the blockchain.
It brings some data that some guy decided to say, and it may or may not be a lie.

Author: MyName#0491
Content:
`Instead you are trusting some person to put some data that may or may not be related to reality onto the blockchain.
There is no cryptoeconomic guarantees that the data on-chain has any relationship to reality.`
An how does that differ from Amoveo?
You've stated that you can manually "hard update" to stop an oracle "about to lie", what "cryptoeconomic guarantees" exist to ensure that what you do "may or may not be related to reality"?
